articles.author: Jeff Benson
articles.description: Brown—who's overseen efforts to release a self-hosted wallet—says she'll "be staying in the crypto space."
articles.title: Robinhood Crypto Lead Christine Brown Leaving to Start Crypto Venture

articles.description: How are decisions made for billion-dollar protocols like Uniswap, Maker, and PancakeSwap? The answer, in part, is through governance tokens.
articles.title: What are Governance Tokens? How Token Owners Shape a DAO's Direction

articles.description: The reactions to a campaign by Ripple's co-founder to change Bitcoin's code have been predictable—and often ferocious.

articles.description: Collections like Solana Monkey Business, Degenerate Apes, and Aurory appear headed to OpenSea after the firm confirms recent leaks.

articles.description: The Ronin bridge was drained of 173,600 ETH and 25.5M USDC via the use of “hacked private keys,” Sky Mavis says.
articles.title: Hacker Drains $622M From Axie Infinity’s Ronin Ethereum Sidechain

articles.description: Snowcrash says the goal of its partnership with Civic is to protect the users of the new platform.

articles.description: Preparing the paperwork for your crypto taxes needn’t be a chore, with tax software like Koinly streamlining the process.
articles.title: How Crypto Tax Software Can Simplify Your Taxes

articles.description: Politicians are embracing crypto on both sides of the aisle. Matt West, running for congress in Oregon, Matthew Diemer, running for congress in Ohio, and former Wyoming Rep. Tyler Lindholm discussed crypto and politics on a panel with Decrypt's Jeff Roberts at Camp Ethereal in Wyoming. As Diemer pointed out, "We have a conservative Republican, a progressive Democrat, and a moderate Democrat on the same stage, unified by crypto and the idea of making sensible regulation."
articles.title: Crypto on the Campaign Trail: Matt West, Matthew Diemer, Tyler Lindholm at Camp Ethereal 2022

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: The NFT-based fantasy soccer game aims to enter additional sports and U.S. leagues.
articles.title: Ethereum NFT Game Sorare Signs Major League Soccer Amid US Expansion

articles.description: A subsidiary of Michael Saylor’s MicroStrategy is leveraging its Bitcoin to buy more Bitcoin with a $205 million loan from Silvergate Bank.
articles.title: MicroStrategy Takes Out $205M Bitcoin-Backed Loan to Buy More Bitcoin

articles.description: Longtime banker turned crypto executive Caitlin Long says Goldman was the big bank most open to crypto, until JP Morgan "ended up flipping" Goldman.
articles.title: Caitlin Long: How JP Morgan Flipped Goldman Sachs in Crypto

articles.description: Proceeds from the NFT sales will support youth impacted by HIV/AIDS.
articles.title: MAC Cosmetics Releases Keith Haring Polygon NFTs with ConsenSys

articles.description: zkLend has raised $5 million to build out its speedy, low-cost lending and borrowing protocol using the Ethereum scaling solution zk-Rollups.

articles.description: Environmental activist groups as well as the CEO and co-founder of Ripple have joined forces to campaign for a code change to Bitcoin.

articles.description: The president released a detailed budget proposal on Monday.
articles.title: Biden Eyes $5 Billion in 2023 Revenue From Applying New Tax Reporting Rules to Crypto

articles.description: The NFT digital trading cards will feature famous wrestlers.
articles.title: WWE Signs Deal to Launch NFTs Through Fanatics’ Candy Digital

articles.description: As Bitcoin recoups its 2022 losses, analysts point to macro events in the market, like D.C. regulators, stablecoin chatter, and fading worries about COVID.
articles.title: Bitcoin Has Now Wiped Away 2022 Losses—Here's Why

articles.description: Rep. Stephen Lynch introduced the ECASH Act. It's a CBDC without the CB.
articles.title: Congress Is Discussing a Digital Dollar Pilot. It's Not What You Think

articles.description: Based on a book series, the collectible card game will offer both Polygon NFTs and physical cards to players.

articles.description: Non-fungible tokens are selling for thousands or even millions of dollars—but assigning a dollar value to them is complicated.
articles.title: NFTs: What Are They Worth?

articles.description: Firms interacting with non-custodial crypto wallets would be expected to collect personal details about the wallet’s owner, according to a new proposal.

articles.description: Canadians, Australians, and Singaporeans were the most curious to know about Ethereum’s imminent upgrade.
articles.title: Google Searches for ‘Ethereum Merge’ Have Hit an All-Time High

articles.description: Innovations like NFTs and DeFi raise questions for crypto taxpayers about how to report them for tax purposes. Here's our handy guide.
articles.title: Crypto Tax Guide: NFTs and DeFi

articles.description: Amid a wider rally in crypto markets, altcoins Filecoin and Internet Computer have seen double-digit gains in the last 24 hours.
articles.title: $140 Million in Bitcoin Shorts Liquidated As Crypto Market Cap Hits $2.1 Trillion

articles.description: Japan is revising its foreign exchange legislation to crack down on the risk of Russia using crypto to evade sanctions.
articles.title: Japan Targets Crypto Loophole to Halt Russian Sanctions Evasion

articles.description: After a stale first quarter, the entire cryptocurrency market appears to be picking back up—for the moment.
articles.title: Bitcoin and Ethereum Spike 5% Amid Crypto Market Sunday Surge

articles.description: Eminem, Jimmy Fallon, Steph Curry, Post Malone, and a dozen other high-profile celebs are now holders of the popular Ethereum NFT collection.

articles.description: Buterin clarified that he doesn't hate Apes, he just wants them to have a more meaningful impact. Madonna, meanwhile, just wants an Ape.
articles.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: Buterin Wants BAYC to Fund Public Goods, Bukele Rails Against Media

articles.description: The new platform aims to be a way for Black artists and creators to showcase their talent—and get paid for their work.
articles.title: African Digital Art Network Launches Nandi NFT Marketplace on Celo

articles.description: Meanwhile, Thailand banned crypto, and Russia signaled to allies it would begin accepting Bitcoin for natural gas exports.
articles.title: This Week in Coins: Leading Coins Rise Again as Florida to 'Figure Out' Accepting Bitcoin For Taxes

articles.description: MakerDAO has either implemented or is currently mulling over new updates to help improve the adoption of its stablecoin.
articles.title: MakerDAO's DAI Fell Behind Terra's UST Months Ago. Here's How It's Trying to Catch Up

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: AVAX was on a tear all week before it fell back on Saturday—and the rise wasn't just about the Avalanche Summit in Barcelona. It's about subnets.
articles.title: Avalanche's AVAX Seeing Boost From Subnets Chatter

articles.author: Jeff John Roberts
articles.description: The boy genius of Ethereum greets the slings and arrows of Twitter trolls and "co-founders" with grace and restraint, a rarity among crypto figures.
articles.title: Vitalik Is the Crypto Hero We Don't Deserve

articles.author: Jeff John Roberts
articles.description: Millions of people made money on crypto last year, and now the IRS is looking for its cut. Here's how to stay out of trouble.
articles.title: The Crypto Taxman is Coming. Should You Be Worried?

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Proceeds from NFT sales will go to the Ukraine Ministry of Digital Transformation.
articles.title: Ukraine Launches NFT Museum of War on Ethereum and Polygon

articles.description: Anthony Georgiades, co-founder of Pastel Network, talks to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at Camp Ethereal 2022 about NFT security and the importance of protecting your digital artwork.
articles.title: Pastel Network's Georgiades: How to Protect Your NFTs

articles.description: Andrew Yang, the former presidential and NYC mayoral candidate, talked crypto regulation in DC on Decrypt's gm podcast with Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts. Yang says the days of little or no crypto regulation in DC are "very very quickly coming to end" and that the question now is what the new rules will look like.
articles.title: Andrew Yang on Crypto Regulation in DC: 'This Train Is Coming. What's the Cargo?'

articles.description: Gitcoin co-founder Scott Moore tells Decrypt's Jason Nelson all about Gitcoin's GR13 grant, which is raising money for Ukraine and has matching participation from a range of Web3 names like OpenSea, OlympusDAO, NounsDAO, Polygon, Algorand, and more.
articles.title: Gitcoin's Scott Moore Talks Ukraine Fundraising Grant

articles.description: Robert Drost, Head of R&D at ConsenSys, talks Layer 2s and building atop Ethereum with James Prestwich of Nomad and Sreeram Kannan of LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming.
articles.title: The Importance of Layer 2: ConsenSys, Nomad, and LayrLabs at Camp Ethereal

articles.description: Jordan Garbis, co-founder of BeetsDAO, and Kent Barton, who does tokenomics at ShapeShift DAO, talk to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming about how to start a DAO, the hurdles with growing them, how to handle tokenomics and reward structure, and how to approach bad behavior by DAO members. At the end, they also took questions from the audience.
articles.title: ShapeShift, BeetsDAO Talk DAO Creation and Governance at Camp Ethereal

articles.description: The former presidential candidate and NYC mayoral candidate has launched Lobby3, a DC lobbying DAO. He talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about his crypto journey, the potential of DAOs, and the need to blend a Web3 approach with "the old-fashioned way" to spur change in DC.
articles.title: gm Podcast, Episode 5: Andrew Yang Wants You to Join His DAO

articles.description: Edward Snowden gives an extensive interview to Marta Belcher of Filecoin Foundation for Camp Ethereal 2022, taped on February 27. He talks about how governments view crypto as "an evolving threat," how crypto "transforms power relationships," why he thinks Ethereum "suffers from the same privacy problems as Bitcoin," and why he views central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) as "crypto-fascist currencies."
articles.title: Edward Snowden Talks Governments and Crypto, CBDCs, and Ethereum vs Bitcoin at Camp Ethereal

articles.description: Musician and DJ Dillon Francis and Big Night Entertainment managing partner Tim Bonito tell Decrypt's Kate Irwin about their deal for a Boston nightclub residency and record collaboration with DJ duo ESCAPΞPLAN, and give their takes on Ethereum vs Solana for buying and trading NFTs.
articles.title: Musician Dillon Francis on Ethereum vs Solana for NFTs

articles.description: Musician and DJ Dillon Francis tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin what drew him to NFTs, and heaps a lot of praise on DJ 3LAU for pioneering in the space and prompting more artists to get in.
articles.title: Musician Dillon Francis: Why I'm Getting Into NFTs

articles.description: ConsenSys CEO Joe Lubin talked about Ethereum 2.0 timing and impact, the power of DAOs, and gave his honest take on NFTs, Solana, Polygon, and Biden's crypto executive order in an extensive fireside chat with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at Camp Ethereal 2022 in Wyoming.
articles.title: Joe Lubin Talks Ethereum 2.0, NFTs, and DAOs at Camp Ethereal

articles.description: FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried sits down for a conversation with one of his heroes, the moral philosopher and Princeton University professor Peter Singer, exclusively for Camp Ethereal 2022, powered by Decrypt. They talk animal rights, climate change, effective giving, Bitcoin's energy use, and how crypto is helping Ukraine.
articles.title: Crypto and Effective Altruism: Sam Bankman-Fried Interviews Peter Singer at Camp Ethereal

articles.description: Decrypt's Dan Roberts and Decrypt Daily podcast host Matthew Diemer chat live in Wyoming about the crypto executive order and other insights from Camp Ethereal 2022.
articles.title: #DecryptLIVE: Biden's Executive Order & Ethereal 2022

articles.description: As Russia’s invasion of Ukraine continues, Ukraine has raised more than $50 million in crypto donations—in Bitcoin, Ethereum, Polkadot, and even Dogecoin. Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Scott Chipolina, and Kate Irwin, joined by special guest Izabella Kaminska of The Blind Spot, discuss the biggest story in the world right now.
articles.title: Decrypting the Week 10: Ukraine Welcomes Crypto

articles.description: On Episode 4 of Decrypt's gm podcast, Muneeb Ali of Stacks gave Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts his take on why NFTs are so triggering to people. He understands why they're easy to make fun of or "dismiss as a toy," but expects them to be used for a whole range of important business purposes in the future.
articles.title: Muneeb Ali: It's 'Easy to Make Fun' of NFTs, But They Are Here to Stay

articles.description: Blanksoles, a decentralized sneaker company, announced a partnership with former NBA champion Metta Sandiford-Artest—better known as Metta World Peace, and before that Ron Artest—to launch "Metta Designsoles," a series of limited edition Solana-based NFTs and physical sneakers. They discuss with Decrypt's Jason Nelson.
articles.title: NBA Alum Metta World Peace and Raymond Dong of Blanksoles Talk NFTs

articles.description: Muneeb Ali is a Bitcoin OG whose project Stacks, formerly Blockstack, pulled off the first SEC-approved token sale for its STX token. But even though Muneeb has become the leading advocate for building dapps on top of the Bitcoin blockchain, don't call him a Bitcoin maximalist. He tells Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts on the gm how he fends off maximalists on Twitter, what he'd do if he were Twitter CEO, and how the Stacks ecosystem is growing.
articles.title: gm Podcast, Episode 4: Fighting Bitcoin Maximalism with Muneeb Ali
